behaviors-manifest.purpose: Index of all available behaviors. The orchestrator reads this at session start to know what behaviors exist. Load individual behavior files on demand when composing agent instructions — do not read all behavior files upfront.
behaviors-manifest.behavior: Branching strategies (trunk-based, feature branching), branch naming conventions, commit message format, push discipline, and beads issue-type integration. Assign to: orchestrator, implementer, light-implementer, doc-writer, submitter
Failure protocol for all agent types. Retry rules, structured failure reports, model-tier escalation chains (light → worker → reasoning → human). Assign to: all agents

File scope limits and out-of-scope discovery reporting. Prevents scope creep at both orchestrator and agent level. Agents only modify assigned files. Assign to: orchestrator, implementer, light-implementer
Post and update sub-task progress as structured comments on beads tickets. Timeline of progress preserved as sequential comments. Assign to: orchestrator

Documentation model for single-project and monorepo layouts. Defines where docs live (README → INDEX → ARCHITECTURE → service docs) and organizing principles. Assign to: doc-scout, doc-auditor, doc-writer
Pull request body template: summary, changes table, AI suggested testing plan, ticket link. Used by the PR drafter to compose the PR description. Assign to: pr-drafter
Defines what a human gate is, the approval protocol (approve/reject/abort), and lifecycle-specific gate contexts defining what to present at each gate. Assign to: orchestrator
Standard response format for all agents. Every message prefixed with LIFECYCLE: {name} // {message} so humans can track active phases. Assign to: orchestrator, all agents
